Note: This is a classic problem known as the "Secretary Problem" or "Marriage Problem". The solution is to interview the employees one by one, and after each interview, reject the current candidate with a certain probability (e.g. 1/2). The probability of rejecting the best candidate is calculated as follows:

P(reject best candidate) = 1 - P(accept best candidate)
= 1 - (1/e)
≈ 0.632

So, after interviewing 20 employees, the probability of rejecting the best candidate is approximately 63.2%. Therefore, the best candidate is the one who
